extendedIngredients.name: butter substitute
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons allowed butter or butter substitute

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, or lemon juice, or more to taste

extendedIngredients.name: nutritional yeast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 tablespoons nutritional yeast (most often in bulk foods sections of well-stocked grocery stores)
metaInformation: (most often in bulk foods sections of well-stocked grocery stores)

extendedIngredients.name: raw cashews
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup raw cashews (next time I might try raw soaked sunflower seeds to make it nut free)
metaInformation: (next time I might try soaked sunflower seeds to make it nut free)

extendedIngredients.name: smoked paprika
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1½ teaspoons smoked paprika (reduce if you don;t like a smoky flavor, but it is a key flavor here!)
metaInformation: (reduce if you don;t like a smoky flavor, but it is a key flavor here!)

extendedIngredients.name: sweet rice flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons sweet rice flour (or any gf flour really)

recipes.title: Real-Food Hot Nacho Cheese Sauce - Dairy & Gluten Free

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are my top picks for Cheese Dip. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. You could try Bellissima Sparkling rosé. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: In a blender, puree all the ingredients through the seasonings until smooth and no gritty texture left from the nuts. I did this for one smoothie cycle in my Blend Tec.Pour into a small saucepan, and gently heat over medium low heat, whisking frequently.When the sauce is thick and creamy, remove from the heat, and stir in the butter and rice vinegar. Store in an airtight container.

steps.step: In a blender, puree all the ingredients through the seasonings until smooth and no gritty texture left from the nuts. I did this for one smoothie cycle in my Blend Tec.

Pour into a small saucepan, and gently heat over medium low heat, whisking frequently.When the sauce is thick and creamy, remove from the heat, and stir in the butter and rice vinegar. Store in an airtight container.
